org.cooperari.core

Class CUncaughtExceptionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cooperari.core.CUncaughtExceptionHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    public final class CUncaughtExceptionHandler
extends Object
implements Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler
    Handler for uncaught thread exceptions.

    Objects of this type may aggregate exceptions from several threads. The aggregated exceptions may be thrown back or wrapped up in a convenient exception type by calling rethrowExceptionsIfAny().

    Since:
    0.2

      • rethrowExceptionsIfAny

        public void rethrowExceptionsIfAny()
        Throw uncaught exceptions, if any.

        The internal exception buffer is cleared, and previously recorded exceptions may be thrown or wrapped up using other exception types, as follows:

        • If no exceptions are recorded, the method does nothing.
        • If exactly one exception is recorded then:
          • The exception is directly re-thrown if it is an instance of Error or RuntimeException (one of the unchecked exception types).
          • Otherwise the exception at stake must be checked ((note that this should never happen but the case is covered in any case), the exception is wrapped up as the cause for a CCheckedExceptionError exception that is thrown. .
        • If more than one exception is recorded, a CMultipleExceptionsError exception is thrown grouping information for all exceptions.
